pr_title: issue #1511 - Include FHIR IGs based on Maven profile

replies.bodyText: With activatedByDefault=true, if another profile is used, then this wouldn't run.  I think I want this one to always run.
replies.author: tbieste

replies.bodyText: This doesn't make sense in a profile then
replies.author: prb112

replies.bodyText: I was able to leave this within a regular build tag, instead of within a profile build tag.  When I had it copying the IG jars too, I think I had needed to make sure of the profile order, but now I can just have it the way it was.
replies.author: tbieste

timeline.bodyText: I'd rather leave this file alone.  Did the approach I shared not work? if so, the profile order makes a difference.
timeline.author: prb112

replies.bodyText:
It did, but it would show a warning like this when not including the IGs:
[WARNING] The following patterns were never triggered in this artifact inclusion filter:
o  'com.ibm.fhir:fhir-ig-*'
Maybe that is ok, but I thought it would be nice to a warnings like that show up by default.
replies.author: tbieste

replies.bodyText: I think the warning is OK. Maybe a note in the distribution.xml <!-- included as there are some transitive dependencies picked up during integration test builds. -->
replies.author: prb112

timeline.bodyText:
minor, but only base spec profiles are built-in (and these are not from any "Implementation Guide").

  
    
      
        Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
            See [Validation Guide - Built-in profile support](https://ibm.github.io/FHIR/guides/FHIRValidationGuide#built-in-profile-support) for a list of pre-packaged Implmentation Guide resources.
          
          
            
            The IBM FHIR Server pre-packages all conformance resources from the core specification.
timeline.author: lmsurpre
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -684,7 +684,11 @@ For example, you can configure a set of FHIRPath Constraints to run for resource
 }
 ```
 
-See the [Validation Guide - Built-in profile support](https://ibm.github.io/FHIR/guides/FHIRValidationGuide#built-in-profile-support) for a list of pre-packaged Implmentation Guide resources and see [Validation Guide - Making profiles available to the fhir registry](https://ibm.github.io/FHIR/guides/FHIRValidationGuide#making-profiles-available-to-the-fhir-registry-component-fhirregistry) for information about how to extend the server with additional Implementation Guide artifacts.
+See [Validation Guide - Built-in profile support](https://ibm.github.io/FHIR/guides/FHIRValidationGuide#built-in-profile-support) for a list of pre-packaged Implmentation Guide resources.

timeline.bodyText:
I think this is probably sufficient, but maybe including a single example could make it even more obvious:

  
    
      
        Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
            The IBM FHIR server has additional implementation guides available in the fhir-validation-distribution.zip artifact, which may be downloaded from [https://github.com/IBM/FHIR/releases](releases). To load an additional implemenation guide, copy the implementation guide's jar from the fhir-validation-distribution.zip artifact into the IBM FHIR server's userlib directory to make it available to the server during startup.
          
          
            
            The IBM FHIR server has additional implementation guides available in the fhir-validation-distribution.zip artifact, which may be downloaded from [https://github.com/IBM/FHIR/releases](releases). To load an additional implemenation guide, copy the implementation guide's jar (e.g. `fhir-ig-us-core-VERSION.jar`) from the fhir-validation-distribution.zip artifact into the IBM FHIR server's userlib directory to make it available to the server during startup.
timeline.author: lmsurpre
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -198,7 +198,7 @@ The IBM FHIR server has built-in support for the following:
 
 ### Optional profile support
 
-The IBM FHIR server has additional implementation guides available in the fhir-validation-distribution.zip artifact, which may be downloaded from [https://github.com/IBM/FHIR/releases](releases).
+The IBM FHIR server has additional implementation guides available in the fhir-validation-distribution.zip artifact, which may be downloaded from [https://github.com/IBM/FHIR/releases](releases). To load an additional implemenation guide, copy the implementation guide's jar from the fhir-validation-distribution.zip artifact into the IBM FHIR server's userlib directory to make it available to the server during startup.

timeline.bodyText:
Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
            The IBM FHIR server has additional implementation guides available in the fhir-validation-distribution.zip artifact, which may be downloaded from [https://github.com/IBM/FHIR/releases](releases). To load an additional implemenation guide, copy the implementation guide's jar (e.g. `fhir-ig-us-core-VERSION.jar`) from the fhir-validation-distribution.zip artifact into the IBM FHIR server's userlib directory to make it available to the server during startup.
          
          
            
            The IBM FHIR server has additional implementation guides available in the fhir-validation-distribution.zip artifact, which may be downloaded from [https://github.com/IBM/FHIR/releases](releases). To load an additional implemenation guide, copy the implementation guide's jar (e.g. `fhir-ig-us-core-VERSION.jar`) from the fhir-validation-distribution.zip artifact into the IBM FHIR Server's userlib directory to make it available to the server during startup.
timeline.author: prb112
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -195,11 +195,18 @@ For more information, please see: [https://confluence.hl7.org/display/FHIR/NPM+P
 The IBM FHIR server has built-in support for the following:
 
 - Profiles defined in the base FHIR Specification (v4.0.1: R4 - Mixed Normative and STU) [http://hl7.org/fhir/profilelist.html](http://hl7.org/fhir/profilelist.html)
+
+### Optional profile support
+
+The IBM FHIR server has additional implementation guides available in the fhir-validation-distribution.zip artifact, which may be downloaded from [https://github.com/IBM/FHIR/releases](releases). To load an additional implemenation guide, copy the implementation guide's jar (e.g. `fhir-ig-us-core-VERSION.jar`) from the fhir-validation-distribution.zip artifact into the IBM FHIR server's userlib directory to make it available to the server during startup.

replies.bodyText: It is written as "IBM FHIR server" in other places in this guide, so I was trying to stay consistent.
replies.author: tbieste

replies.bodyText: yeah we need to be consistent with IBM FHIR Server, when you see it please update
replies.author: prb112
